## SDQ vs TFLB

In the field of psychology, the process of comparing different questionnaires to draw parallels or evaluate individual outcomes is a vital but often challenging task. This is particularly true when dealing with instruments like the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and the Timeline-Followback Interview (TFLB). The SDQ assesses behavioural problems in children, while the TFLB evaluates alcohol use over a given period. Comparing these vastly different tools can pose quite a challenge, but this is where Harmony comes into the picture. Harmony is an advanced software developed with psychologists in mind. It employs natural language processing and AI models to help researchers compare and harmonise questionnaire items. The SDQ vs TFLB comparison, an otherwise long and tedious process, can be easily streamlined through Harmony. The tool can also match items from these questionnaires in different languages, bolstering its utility in international research scenarios. When comparing SDQ and TFLB with Harmony, researchers can either pick instruments from Harmony's exhaustive database or upload their own in PDF format. This flexibility makes the process of SDQ vs TFLB more efficient, reducing manual effort and boosting accuracy and reliability. Harmony's AI models can yield a percentage match between the SDQ and TFLB instruments, providing valuable insights for comparative studies. Consider enhancing the efficiency and effectiveness of your SDQ vs TFLB comparison by using Harmony today.

## Compare the items in SDQ and TFLB

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and TFLB into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just TFLB into Harmony</a> - compare TFLB with other instruments
